content.question: At a photography contest, entries are scored on a scale from 1 to 100. At a recent contest with 1,000 entries, a score of 68 was at the <math alttext="seventy seventh" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>77</mn><mtext>th</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> percentile of the distribution of all the scores. Which of the following is the best description of the <math alttext="seventy seventh" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>77</mn><mtext>th</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> percentile of the distribution?

choices.label: There were 770 entries with a score less than or equal to 68.
There were at least 230 entries with a score of 77.
There were 23% of the entries with a score less than or equal to 68.
There were 77% of the entries with a score equal to 68.
There were at least 77% of the entries with a score greater than 68.

content.answer: There were 770 entries with a score less than or equal to 68.

topic.text: 1.7: Summary Statistics for a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Calculate summary statistics, relative positions of points within a distribution, correlation, and predicted response.
